DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the means by which a tissue specimen or fluid was removed from the breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Removal of a sample of breast tissue, which is then examined under a microscope.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredDefinition: The removal of a sample of tissue, which is then examined under a microscope to check for cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._Any stepwise set of actions._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

PermissibleValues.value: I need help answering this question

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Required; necessary, not optional.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

Concepts.definition: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

PermissibleValues.value: Open Biopsy (a surgical removal of a sample of the lump or the entire lump)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated system generated definition with current NCIt definition. mc 11/12/12

PermissibleValues.value: Core Biopsy (like fine needle aspiration, but uses a larger needle to remove a sample of the lump)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

PermissibleValues.value: Fine Needle Aspiration (a non-surgical biopsy in which a small needle is used to take a sample of cells from the breast lump or drain fluid from a cyst)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
